an4.140:4.3: There’s a speaker who runs out of meaningful things to say, but not of ways of phrasing things.
an4.140:4.4: There’s a speaker who runs out of ways of phrasing things, but not of meaningful things to say.
an4.140:4.5: There’s a speaker who runs out of both meaningful things to say, and ways of phrasing things.
an4.140:4.6: There’s a speaker who never runs out of meaningful things to say, or ways of phrasing things.
an4.140:4.8: It is impossible, it cannot happen that someone accomplished in the four kinds of textual analysis will ever run out of meaningful things to say, or ways of phrasing things.”
